channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Traffic light changes to red for no reason, 16th July
item.description:
Kingsditch Road traffic lights Traffic lights just after Upperfield Road turn to red very quickly. (South facing) While traffic on other side is still flowing. Causing constant traffic congestion
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wymans Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Multiple new fences appearing across Daisy Bank Field, 16th July
item.description:
The issue affects multiple locations and all the Rights of Way across Daisy Bank Field. In past few weeks, several new fences and gates have appeared, with insulators at the tops of the fence posts for electric wire.One particular fence excludes a 20metre strip at the west field boundary. An area of the field adjacent to Undercliff Avenue has been fenced off and being bulldozed.I can find no authorisation for these works on the GCC site and I am concerned that an illegal land grab may be in process. Please check this out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Standard Gauge Incline, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole left side of road going towards church, 15th July
item.description:
Houses didn't have easily spotted house numbers, so I couldn't tell which house it was directly outside.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Church Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass obstructing the footpath, 15th July
item.description:
This is all the way along Cirencester road from the Little Witcombe sign and then all the way to the Dog lane turning in various places. Whilst it's not continuous in places you have to walk in the road because the path is fully overgrown. Especially round the A417 overpass.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 51 - 61 Hazel Way, Lobleys Drive, Brockworth, GL3 4GL, 15th July
item.description:
The five trees lining the grass verge of Hazel Way have become overgrown, extending into the road and are now encroaching on the pathway at head height. They are also starting to hang over into the gardens of the properties along the street. These trees significantly obstruct visibility for pedestrians at the two nearby crossings and completely obscure the 'NO HGV' sign in the crescent, potentially contributing to the ongoing issue of lorries mistakenly using Lobley's bridge which is not suitable for HGV's. On the opposite side of the street, the trees have very recently had their canopies lifted, thus significantly improving visibility for drivers and pedestrians. Applying the same treatment to the five trees on Hazel Way's side would further enhance visibility for everyone and improve road safety.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lobleys Drive, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
